alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Delaware (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:04PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of Buchanan and Delaware Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms over Winthrop, or 7 miles east of Independence, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rowley and Independence. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 49 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
